mri_findings: Smooth, homogeneous lesion with no aggressive features.
clinical_note: Priya Sharma, a 60-year-old female, presents with occasional dizziness. MRI of the brain reveals a smooth, homogeneous lesion without aggressive features, suggestive of a benign brain tumor. Neurological examination is unremarkable. Discussed management options including observation and potential surgical intervention. Follow-up in 3 months for reassessment.

mri_findings: Irregular enhancing mass lesion seen in the brain with mass effect.
clinical_note: Aishwarya Patel, 70-year-old female, presents with progressive headache, vomiting, and seizures. MRI brain reveals an irregular enhancing mass lesion with significant mass effect. Provisional diagnosis of malignant brain tumor established. Further evaluation and management plan to be discussed with oncology. Follow-up scheduled for next week.

mri_findings: Small non-enhancing lesion seen, appearance consistent with low-grade tumor.
clinical_note: Rohan Singh, a 47-year-old male, presents with occasional dizziness. MRI of the brain reveals a small non-enhancing lesion, consistent with a low-grade tumor. Provisional diagnosis is benign brain tumor. Further evaluation and management options were discussed with the patient. Follow-up appointment scheduled to monitor symptoms and plan for possible intervention.

mri_findings: Irregular enhancing mass lesion seen in the brain with mass effect.
clinical_note: Priya Kumar, a 54-year-old female, presents with weakness in limbs. MRI of the brain reveals an irregular enhancing mass lesion with associated mass effect. Provisional diagnosis is a malignant brain tumor. Further evaluation and management options discussed with the patient. Referral to oncology for treatment planning is recommended.

mri_findings: MRI brain is normal. No focal lesion or abnormality detected.
clinical_note: Riya Sharma, a 41-year-old female, presented with a chief complaint of mild tension headache. MRI brain results are normal with no focal lesions or abnormalities detected. Provisional diagnosis indicates no tumor. Recommend conservative management with analgesics and lifestyle modifications. Follow-up if symptoms persist or worsen.

mri_findings: Smooth, homogeneous lesion with no aggressive features.
clinical_note: Arjun Kumar, a 45-year-old male, presents with occasional dizziness. MRI brain reveals a smooth, homogeneous lesion without aggressive features, suggestive of a benign brain tumor. Neurological examination is unremarkable. Discussed management options including observation and potential surgical intervention. Follow-up in 3 months for reassessment.

mri_findings: MRI shows an enhancing brain tumor with irregular margins and surrounding edema.
clinical_note: Divya Patel, a 43-year-old female, presents with progressive headache, vomiting, and seizures. MRI of the brain reveals an enhancing tumor with irregular margins and surrounding edema. Provisional diagnosis is a malignant brain tumor. Further evaluation and management options will be discussed with the patient and family.

mri_findings: MRI shows an enhancing brain tumor with irregular margins and surrounding edema.
clinical_note: Arjun Patel, a 28-year-old male, presents with personality changes. MRI of the brain reveals an enhancing tumor with irregular margins and surrounding edema. Provisional diagnosis is a malignant brain tumor. Further evaluation and management options discussed with the patient. Referral to oncology for multidisciplinary approach recommended.

mri_findings: Smooth, homogeneous lesion with no aggressive features.
clinical_note: Riya Patel, a 49-year-old female, presents with occasional dizziness. MRI brain reveals a smooth, homogeneous lesion without aggressive features, suggestive of a benign brain tumor. Neurological examination is unremarkable. Discussed management options including observation and potential surgical intervention. Follow-up in 3 months for reassessment.

mri_findings: MRI shows an enhancing brain tumor with irregular margins and surrounding edema.
clinical_note: Aryan Gupta, a 45-year-old male, presents with personality changes. MRI of the brain reveals an enhancing tumor with irregular margins and surrounding edema. Provisional diagnosis is a malignant brain tumor. Further evaluation and management options will be discussed. Follow-up appointment scheduled for next week.

mri_findings: Large hyperintense lesion on T1 with contrast enhancement suggestive of high-grade tumor.
clinical_note: Arjun Singh, 54-year-old male, presents with progressive headache, vomiting, and seizures. MRI brain reveals a large hyperintense lesion on T1 with contrast enhancement, suggestive of a high-grade tumor. Provisional diagnosis is malignant brain tumor. Further evaluation and management plan to be discussed. Follow-up scheduled for next week.

mri_findings: MRI shows an enhancing brain tumor with irregular margins and surrounding edema.
clinical_note: Karan Reddy, 23-year-old male, presented with weakness in limbs. MRI brain reveals an enhancing tumor with irregular margins and surrounding edema, suggestive of a malignant brain tumor. Neurological examination shows motor deficits in both upper and lower limbs. Further management including oncological referral and possible biopsy is advised. Follow-up scheduled for next week to discuss treatment options.

mri_findings: MRI reveals a well-defined extra-axial lesion, likely benign (meningioma/low-grade).
clinical_note: Aishwarya Singh, 20-year-old female, presents with a chief complaint of mild headache. MRI of the brain shows a well-defined extra-axial lesion, suggestive of a benign tumor, likely a meningioma or low-grade tumor. No acute intracranial abnormalities noted. Patient advised to monitor symptoms and follow up for further evaluation and management. Provisional diagnosis: Benign Brain Tumor.

mri_findings: MRI shows an enhancing brain tumor with irregular margins and surrounding edema.
clinical_note: Rohan Reddy, a 74-year-old male, presents with personality changes. MRI of the brain reveals an enhancing tumor with irregular margins and surrounding edema. Provisional diagnosis is a malignant brain tumor. Neurological examination shows cognitive impairment consistent with the imaging findings. Discussed treatment options including neurosurgical intervention and oncological management.

mri_findings: Large hyperintense lesion on T1 with contrast enhancement suggestive of high-grade tumor.
clinical_note: Priya Kumar, a 61-year-old female, presents with weakness in limbs. MRI brain reveals a large hyperintense lesion on T1 with contrast enhancement, suggestive of a high-grade tumor. Provisional diagnosis is malignant brain tumor. Further evaluation and management options discussed with the patient. Follow-up appointment scheduled for next week.
